1.content:
When You Gotta Go
(Choices 2-4 have been unlisted, leaving 1 and 5.)

Challenges
Three set categories designed to exercise different subjects for anyone interested to jump right into--Suggested to those who may want to practice or play with the following subjects to focus on:
New Characters
Original Characters
Themes & Context
Cobbled together from the old story branches prior to the 4-23-19 re-organization.

Standard Categories
Categories taking a page from other, popularly organized stories on similar subjects here at Writing.com. Sift through choices leading to specifying a character to write about, starting with gender, leading to whether they're human or not, then their age, and finally individual concepts/ideas where we can settle on a story.
1.title: When you gotta go, you gotta go

11.content:
A set of three categories intended to act as challenges or quick suggestions for anyone interested. Re-worked from the old version of "When You Gotta Go!". The choices are 1, 4 and 5 since 2 and 3 have been unlisted. Some original stories have been deleted, though I have saved my own as well as one other story.

New Characters

Stories that involve brand new characters that you conceive and design right now and get to writing! Spontaneity is a good thing; just think of a character idea you'd like to run with and start typing. Intended to foster new ideas and just seeing where they go.

Original Characters

Stories that can be about original characters that you've already had that you may want to write more about, as well as letting others give their interpretation. This is where you can place your own already established characters into a situation of your choice, develop it how you'd like or let others decide what they'd like to see. The intention is to show your own ideas off as well as add to that of others so that we might exchange new ideas or compare writing styles and subjects to each other.

Themes & Context

Themes are what tie stories together, the answer to the question "What is this story about?" which is something we as writers should be able to answer if asked. It could be described as "a unifying or dominant idea" according to dictionary.com.

Context can be described as "The set of circumstances or facts that surround a particular event, situation, etc" according to dictionary.com. it's something that should be represented within any story so that readers have a good idea of the overall situation, leading to a more fulfilling environment and a sense of immersion.

Themes & context are both absolutely integral to any story, even quick, casual ones. Here we can focus on the themes and/or context first, and think of original characters to insert within once we start writing.

Remember for each Challenge:
If the story hasn't started yet and we're only looking at choices, always leave an 'other' option.
If the story has started, leaving an 'other' option is optional.
11.title: Challenges

111.content:
Quick scenarios you think up and roll with. Bring out a brand new character, write a little about them and perhaps a situation they might be in and have fun, see where it goes.

1111.content:
Young Maxwell Fenrisian, or just Max for short, was a friendly, easy going pup. He had warm grey fur, and amber eyes. He was quite the goofball, but was smooth and charismatic for a lad his age.

Currently, the four year old puppy was playing hide and seek with his friends. He had been feeling off for a fair while today, but couldn't quite put his thumb on it. As he crouched down beneath the slide, shaded by the twisting plastic, he got his answer.

Before he could put paw to Pull-Up and cotton, he felt the funny feeling in his gut subside, and a large warm growth expand the back of his Pull-Up.

You see, Max had one big secret. Unlike most of his peers, he wasn't fully trained. He could use the toilet at home no problemo, but when out and about, especially when his mom wasn't around, he'd clog up upon seeing a toilet, and later end up filling his pants at the worst, hence the Pull-Up, JUST in case, or having to "go" in an unorthodox place at best.

He groaned as he finished up, slowly getting up. He could go and try to grab one of the spares he had stashed around the preschool and go change, wait to be checked when they were going back in and get changed, or dispose of his used training pants and go commando for the time being. He could play off the smell. He....

1112.content:
If ever there was a resplendent, shimmering example of a girl's passion
for expression, it was Kristy. Kristy was a golden labrador in a family of
golden labradors who certainly loved dancing.It seemed that they only got
better and better as a family as it went on. And the latest in their line
was Kristy, always sweeping and whiffing everything with her tail as she
move to and fro. It would certainly seem as though she'd have her presence
respected, though there was just one issue. Sometimes she'd answer the
call to dance before the call of nature...

"Oh, watch this!" Kristy said as she darted down the street, hopping and
spinning from stone to stone. Her sisters followed. "Um, are you sure
about that?" One said as she monitored Kristy, knowing the tell tale way
her little sis would move when it was "time to go". Kristy kept hopping
along, entering the town. "Uh huh! Come on, watch!" She said, playing with
other children as they pass by.

Kristy had already wandered off with some other children, beginning to
enter some stores and then walking outside, seeing other children. By that
time, she simply couldn't continue hiding what she had to do, and started
to squirm a bit as she danced. She looked down at her pink t-shirt and
white shorts, then around to the others, hoping maybe they wouldn't see
her as she paused in a corner for a moment.

Kristy crouched in a corner slightly out of view, her shorts slightly
drooping below her panties. What did she do after that?

11131.content:
"Are you sure you went potty already?" Mom asked, turning her head slightly without taking her eyes off the road. "Yeah, mom!" Roy answered, kicking his feet one after the other in his large car seat fastened behind her on the passenger's side. "Did he?" Mom glanced to the passenger's seat. "That's what he told me!" Roy's aunt replied. "Yeah, I did!" Roy barked in a frustrated tone. "I did already. When are we going home?" he whined, trying to look out the window. Roy's mother nearly scoffed. "Oh, Roy, this is probably going to be a while. Remember I said we're going to preschool today?" She glanced toward the backseat as Roy's aunt added to her. "Yeah, preschool? It'll be fun!" She said, trying to sound cheery. Roy just winced in response since even if he didn't know what it would be like, he did know that he probably wouldn't like it.

Roy crossed his arms as he watched his mom and aunt leave the room, feeling a bit of anxiety, but not quite as badly as some of the other, more upset first-timers at preschool. He felt a little more at ease since it seemed the lady speaking to the room and his mom got along well when they met, so maybe she would nice like his mom was. He thought that maybe he wouldn't like being there, but once he was around the other kids his age walking around and doing things without him, he knew he didn't like being there. He also didn't like his mom not taking him home earlier, especially because he thought that he could lie about going potty and that it would be okay as long as he was heading home to get changed, again. He stood until the teacher started talking to the small classroom, thinking about how long he could ignore anything related to the potty before going home.

"...So I'm glad everyone is having a good time!" The lady spoke to the small class with a smile, nodding slightly to another lady near the corner. "If you need a teacher, just talk to me or her. Now, we can try something fun in just a moment. Before that, does anyone have to go to the bathroom?" She asked in a particularly inquisitive tone. The children in the room mostly stayed quiet, some looking to one another. Roy just stood where he was while the teacher continued. "Anyone have to go potty? Anyone?" She asked nicely as Roy almost put his hand up, but chose to stand still. "Nuh-uh..." He said under his breath as two or three other kids raised their hands. "Okay, no problem. It's right here, see everyone? You can just talk to us if you need to go..." She addressed the rest of the class, Roy trying to look in a different direction.

After brief introductions from everyone to everyone else in class, Roy giving his own clammy greeting on his turn, everyone sat at small, round tables where several toys, blocks and knickknacks were spread out. "Why not look at all the stuff we have, hm? And when you're done, try to share it with your neighbor." The assistant teacher hovered over each of the tables. Most of the children were busy putting things together or moving things around, but Roy didn't even want to play if it meant he just had to give it to someone else right after he started. He also started to wonder if it was almost time to go home only about an hour and fifteen minutes after he'd arrived. Roy fiddled with the few idle toys in front of him without any particular interest, half due to knowing he'd be giving it up almost right away, and half due to the feeling of still needing to go potty. He tried not to think about it, but the more he sat in place, the more thought about it more and more. Then he had to start trying to forget about asking the teachers to take him, since it really didn't sound like a lot of fun. Besides, he just had to hold it until he went home, or at least got to the car so his mom or his aunt could change him later. Eventually he felt like it might take longer than he thought to go home, causing him to think about maybe asking the teachers to help him out. But he just kept thinking about how uninteresting it sounded, or embarrassing to ask for that during playtime. So Roy continued to sit where he was, trying to avoid all thoughts about going potty. He just turned his chin up completely at the idea of asking or going or anything, that was that.

After Roy made his decision, he sat idly playing with things by himself as...

1143.content:
Gnira the Rat Punk: This rat has a knack for getting on people's nerves, and is somewhat known as the "school bully." He's crude, a bit messy, and confident to the bone, though he has one secret: he still wears diapers, even in high school! His parents gave up on proper training, so he has little bladder control and his other needs can get out of hand... Will he make it through a another day and keep his punk-ish, intimidating reputation? Will his big secret get out, and if so, how will he handle it?

Alvas the Sleepy Opossum: Alvas is a bit unusual. With the ears and tail of an opossum along with gray hair and eyes, he would stand out among humans or anthros. In case that wasn't enough, the boy suffers from narcolepsy and struggles to sleep at night. On his first day of "real" school after a few years of homeschooling, how will he manage? Can he make friends without putting people off or, worse, embarrassing himself?
1143.title: Original Characters, Continued

11432.content:
It's a cold morning, and Alvas awakes with a faint shiver. For an elementary school student, he looks so tired—darkness under his eyes, blank, fatigued expression, etc. He pulls his covers aside and tugs up his striped pajamas, finding his nighttime diaper mostly dry. "Not so bad..." he squeakily mutters as he crawls out of bed, looking around.

His room looks more mature than that of most second graders. It's pretty simple, with some photos decorating the yellowish walls, a dresser for his clothes, and a desk, with a few shelves of books above it. As he waits for his mom to come, he changes into fresh underwear and tosses the hardly used padding. At least he's potty trained in the daytime.

"Sweetie, time for breakfast. Are you up?" his mother calls. And with that, he slips on some cargo shorts and heads downstairs, tail dragging lazily behind him.

Alvas is a small boy, so breakfast is never very substantial—just something to get him going before his daily classes. Of course, today he'll be going to a real school, with other kids, so his mother went above and beyond.

"Oatmeal with honey!" his marsupial mother says cheerily, placing the bowl in front of the expressionless boy. He yawns, beginning to eat as she fixed his drink.

"Juice, sweetie? Or milk?" As the boy dogs into his food, enjoying it in spite of his demeanor, he thinks. He did like milk, but lately, it had been messing with his stomach—he read about something like that in a book, and it was called "lacktease untolerance" or something. Then again, juice tended to go right through him, and a full bladder might be a bad way to start off his day.

With that in mind, what does he decide?
11432.title: Alvas, the o'possum-ish

In the end, nothing beats a nice, tall glass of milk. Quietly, the boy responds to his soft-furred mother, who pours him a glass of rich dairy to go with his breakfast. The milk disappears quickly, and he finishes his oatmeal after several minutes. "There we go, Alvas," his mother coos, brushing her "baby" boy's bedhead while he briefly zones out.

"I have your lunchbox and backpack ready, so you can head on to school. Oh, don't doze off! The bus will be here any minute!" He gets an embarrassing smooch on the forehead before he's given his things.

Though he's hardly aware, the boy is soon being nudged out the door, down to the sidewalk, and onto his school bus. It's not until he starts walking down the aisle that he realizes what's going on. Still, it doesn't phase him to be back off autopilot, since it happens pretty often.

Most of his soon-to-be classmates are anthros, with humans sprinkled in. His odd appearance earns him some strange looks and giggles, but he manages to find an empty seat without incident. Finally, the noise around him becomes less bothersome. Alvas begins to nod off.

When he awakes, the opossum realizes...

Alvas doesn't get to nap for long; within a few minutes, someone has cozied up beside him, and his senses are assaulted before he can even open his eyes. An unusual, sour odor hits his nose, and as he finally turns... he's met with a skunk!

Well, skunkette, actually, and she's giving him a rather presumptuous hug! The soft-furred kiddo is wearing a cutesy pink dress with matching bows in her hair. Her tail, which has a big, pink ribbon wrapped around it, flits side to side as her natural, mephitic scent tickles the boy's nose. "Hi, my name is Victoria!! You're new!" Her energetic greeting is met with... a somewhat blank stare, and a wrinkled nose. The boy's mouth opens just a bit.

"O-oh, I'm sorry. My mom and dad say I get too touchy! Just thought you needed a friend..."

She kicks her feet idly, wringing her hands now. From the look of it, she needs a friend as much as the new kid does. "Um.. hi Victoria, I'm Alvas." His voice is calm, if a bit wary. The ends of his mouth curl up subtly in a reassuring smile. He holds out his hand, like his mom had taught him...

...buuut Victoria just squeals eagerly, and suddenly wraps her arms around Alvas. Her grasp is tighter than he ever could've expected from someone like her, and he swears he can hear a pop! While doing his best to return his new friend's hug, though, he feels a rumble coming from...

11432122.content:
What's the problem?

Stormy Edit:If you're not going to write anything substantial, I will.

Alvas paused, hearing a soft churning against Victoria's tense stomach as she sat back in place, showing him a disarming smile. "I guess I just love hugs! Can you tell?" She shrank in her seat, chirping to her Opossum-y neighbor.

Looking her over, Alvas felt his own stomach in response to the strange noise he'd heard. He re-assured himself that it wasn't in fact that he was hungry, and he didn't feel sick. He did know, however that the noise he'd heard sure sounds like the kind of noise that comes out whenever someone had an empty stomach, but perhaps it could have been the opposite. He tried working up a grin to flash back at Victoria, failing to do so as he resigned to taking a breath before trying to say what was on his mind. "Huh. Uh...Are you oka--"

"Tummy trouble? Um, no." Victoria assumed a different pose, her paws at her sides of the seat. "I mean, not really. I mean, um--Anyway!" She beamed a brigther smile than she had before. "What about you?" She inquired, looking a rather furtive Alvas over. The mostly-Opossum tried to look away, scritching the fur on the back of his neck. "Y-yeah." He managed to muster up, looking Victoria over as she bounced in place in her seat. He spoke back up. "You mean like..." He pressed his own stomach, looking to her and then the other students as he tried to briefly gauge her reaction. She seemed to be stiffly looking him over, keeping a playful grin pinned to her snout. "...Like, um...Yeah. It's okay. I'm just sort of...I don't know." Alvas took a breath, glancing in another direction as Victoria crossed her legs.

"You don't knooww?" She cocked her head as she swished her tail around. "What don't you know? Hey--Where'd you go last year?" She smiles a bit wider. Alvas looked back to her, then back out the window. "Last year? Go where? I...Oh. Oh, yeah, school and stuff." He muttered to a nodding Victoria. "Yeah! School, which--" She grunted softly as she seemed tense, her paws holding her against the seat. "Which one? I went to--" She paused as a sharp bubbling, dubious as to whether it was from hunger or not perforated her response. "Uuummm, wellll...Um. What were we talking about?" She bounced in place before suddenly leaning past Alva and supporting herself with one paw on his lap. "Oh wait, are we almost at school yet? Ooh, Are we?" She rubbed her legs together as she looked out the window. Alvas nervously shifted in place, trying not to interrupt the clearly mobile girl crawling over himself at the window. "Oh. I don't know...I--" Alvas muttered again, stopping as the skunk's paw pressed her lower stomach again, quickly sitting down in place before bouncing a few more times. "A-aw, c'mon, what d-don't you know?" She smiled a crooked smile before pausing one more time. She sighed hard, shaking her head. "Oh and um, looks like we're not there yet. Mmph." She grumbled in a half-sigh, half-grunt. She began to kick her legs a few times, humming to herself before leaning in and out, bouncing in her seat a few more times.

Then, Victoria suddenly leaned in, whispering to Alvas...
11432122.title: ...her gut!

114322.content:
As much as he loves milk, Alvas feels juice is the wiser choice for his sensitive stomach. "Juice, please," he responds, soon receiving a tall glass of orange juice to go with his meal. He drinks somewhat slowly, since the sour beverage isn't his favorite, but it at least gives him a little energy.

Once he's done, his mother quickly fixes his hair and helps him get his backpack on. "I love you, Alvas. Be good on your first day, okay?" The kiddo nods, giving her a sleepy but genuine hug.

"I will, Mommy. I love you too." It's surprisingly easy to get the boy out the door, in spite of the new challenges he'd be enduring. Ever the little angel, he simply heads down the sidewalk and onto the bus, waving goodbye to a happy, if a bit anxious mother.

"Hey, sweetie. Good morning."

The young four and a half-year-old boy started to sit up in his bed.

"Ready for your first big day?" Mom sat on the edge of his bed, looking at him.

Keith nodded, feeling butterflies in his stomach. Today was his first day at this place called 'preschool'. He felt nervous, but he was still excited.

"Alright, first, let's check to see if you were dry." Mom took Keith by the hand and got him out of bed. Keith started to undress, taking off his pants, revealing his night Pull-Up. The stars were faded.

"Awww..." He said, a little sad, but understanding. He still had a ways to go.

"Let's get you into some good clothing for the day." Mom got out some underwear for Keith to change into, which he began to put on, and then she got out two shirts.

"Red or green?" she asked.

"Green," Keith affirmed.

Soon, Keith was outfitted in a green shirt, brown shorts, and grey shoes with white socks.

Trish and dad were already at the breakfast table. Trish was eating in a white T-shirt and her pink Pull-Up, eating some oatmeal, and being watched by Dad.

"You excited for the big day, champ?" Dad asked, and Keith nodded.

The morning meal of oatmeal (brown sugar flavored) passed by quickly.

"Trish, do you have to go potty?" Mom asked Trish.

"...no," Trish said, but Keith shook his head.

"I gonna go." Keith headed to the bathroom, to pee a little. He didn't have to go that badly, but he knew that going now was better than going later.

As Keith sat down on the toilet, he heard the pattering of feet down the hall and saw Trish walk in. Trish headed over to her plastic training potty, pulling her Pull-Up down and sitting along with Keith.

The two sat for a few moments, and Keith let out a stream of pee into the potty. Once he finished, he got up and headed to wash his hands. As he cleaned up, he heard his sister peeing a little as well.

Soon, Keith was ready to get into the car. Mom was staying home to supervise Trish's potty use, so dad drove to the preschool.

"You look like death dude," Will smirked, scanning the brunette up and down. Alex sighed before leaning against the locker.

"I had a long morning," Alex offered as explanation. And by 'long' he meant incredibly rushed and overly hectic. He was awoken to the ungodly sound of his mother screaming bloody murder at the neighbour who opened his families gate in the middle of the night so that his dog would get out and, as the neighbour put it, hopefully get run over. That led to Alex and his mum frantically searching for Missy, his dog. By the time they found her Alex had just enough time to get dressed and head off to school.

"Let's hope today is still as fun as they say it'll be," Will replied, not bothering to ask his friend to elaborate further. "Everyone's heading towards the buses now. They said we'll be leaving for our tour of the Science Museum in ten minutes. Should we head over now?"

It depends on who you ask or what you see when you look at them, regarding how these high-functioning animals look like. Anything from within the animal kingdom nearly sharing the silhouette of a human (with the likely addition of ears, snouts or beaks and a tail, or some combination of those or other features), all the way up to having distinctive animal features, every curve and angle retained from their feral counterparts retained as they manage tasks we execute, and just as easily. It could also be the case that you'd see one with large, expressive features and naturally bright colors with a nonsensical gait almost as if one walked right out of a cartoon.

Normally, when a child regresses, it's something to take notice of. A child wetting their undies because they moved houses, or isn't getting enough attention because of a baby sibling, or a pet's death. It's something to comfort, and talk through, and maybe, if necessary, help them re-train.

There is one exception to this: Getting sick.

In most cases, sickness can ruin potty training, but it only lasts as long as the sickness itself. A stomach bug or cold or flu can mean a trip back to diapers, but it's usually temporary, and they'll be back in Pull-Ups or undies in no time.

1512121.content:
The flu had been around for a couple of days and shown no sight of eventually stopping. For Ash's Mother; this was a concerning turn of events as flu season had gone and went with nothing substantial happening to her son. Ash had been recently toilet-trained -- quite easily, in fact. But this particular strain of common flu had an infamous tendency to affect the lizard immune system in many different ways compared to their warm-blooded anthropomorphic friends.

A side-effect of certain types of flu leaves a lizard or two with a sensitive bladder. For Ash -- having proudly wearing his underwear as a sign of his triump in potty training -- eventually flipped as his bladder was seemingly unable to control itself even in the most basic of situations.

His underwear was eventually removed. Which immediately fustrated Ash to no end; his body wriggled and turned from side to side as a pair of controlling hands invaded his personal space and held him down.

"Don't wriggle," Lara grunted, "You can't walk around without protection."

"Why do I gotta wear this?" Ash huffed, "Nuttin' wrong with me! I don't feel bad!"

"I'm not arguing over this," Lara replied, she pulled the sides of her son's diaper over and applied the sticky tapes onto the landing zone. With Ash's crotch area now covered in absorbent padding, she felt less resistance the longer the diaper clung to his body. "This flu is bad, honey. We can't have any accidents on the carpet."

"Not fair!" Ash moaned, slightly feeling his cheeks burn red in embarrasment, "My friends dun' wear diapers!"

Arguing with a three-year old wasn't going to make things better. Lara knew that. She grabbed her son by his waist; hoisting him over to his drawers and collected his brown shorts, soon slowly pulling them up and adjusting his buttons. Despite having to re-diaper her son -- he looke adorable with the sudden blatant bulge appaearing in the back of his shorts.

"Run along, honey." Lara smiled, "If I catch you trying to rip that diaper off, then you're gonna be in so much trouble."

Creatures that could be larger or smaller, or more charming or beastly than either of the former categories. Many know these creatures as figures in myths, who can say whether this is the truth or not? Others know they have their own lands and their own devices they deal with, generally far removed from that of our world. Other times, they might be an integral part of our world without the vast majority ever knowing it, from perching on our shoulder as we make decisions, or keeping an eye on an entire city from the clouds. There's bound to be maybe creatures that reside within the elusive veil of myths. Or, those that haven't been recorded by history as of yet, still waiting to come out. You'll have to describe those yourself, of course.

Roughly, around what time in their life did this fantastic creature have to do their business this time? (Or, if due to immortality or inconceivably long life span this is non-applicable, was this time during their earliest, most fond period of time, toward the middle, or toward their latest most fond period of time experienced?)

1513111.content:
Back in the olden days, the days when King Yama--Ol' Enma Daiou had some influence over things, where you would be sure to use your big iron club covered in spikes for work or leisure--Things were different, not like they are today. There were a decent amount of lost souls to 'help' along their way, and plenty of new natives to 'play' with when spending one's own time traveling--Even before the unification, it was a much simpler time.

Ryota had been making quite the name for himself even when he was a toddler, or whatever equivalent of one that an Oni would go through. It was just that time, or more specifically, it had been that time for quite a while. Centuries prior to the unification or anything like that was even an idea in anyone's mind, this crimson-skinned, snaggle-toothed oni tyke with bushy hair like black fire spent year after year, decade after decade playing and competing with others in his clan, and those outside of it, or other yokai, or the occasional native with a rather unforgettably passionate attitude, though it was not the only thing that was unforgettable about him.

"Put it...ON!" Growled a frustrated, paternal oni as he stood over Ryota, dodging a frenzy of fussy kicks as he tried desperately to fasten a rather uncomfortable yet effective enough waist-wrap that was much broader, and more thick than the loincloths Ryota's friends were wearing. "Nnnooo!" The oni whined in a gruff voice as he folded his arms, trying to fight the inevitable. His father eventually out-maneuvered his legs eventually, snatching him up and setting him down off the nearly flat rock, giving him a strong pat on the rear.

"Whew. Finally." The father sighed. "That ought to do it for now." He grumbled, watching Ryota scamper off. "HEY! You know what to do when you--Are you listening to me?!" He growled as he caught up with Ryota, still trying to go out to play. "If you let loose in your diaper, just let em' change you." He said sternly to the oni, trying to tug his way away. "You got that? At this rate we'll never get you into a tigerskin wrap..." He rolled his eyes. "Listen, LISTEN! You're gonna make us look bad if you go around in a dirty diaper all the time. What would the other yokai think!? How many decades since your friends stopped wearing diapers!?" He went on for a while before sighing and letting go of Ryota. "What's the use?" He muttered. "You'd better come back clean, or else!" He yelled as he saw the little red one off, hoping that this time the idea of punishments hanging overhead would make things different this time.

Ryota scuttled out, no concern about how or when he'd end up in need of yet another change, but that being a priority found itself at the back of his mind when he...

1513132.content:
Ferdinand is a young centaur. His human upper body is about the same size as his same-age peers, though combined with his lower horse body, he is a lot bigger than all and also taller and stronger than most twoleg kids his age. He hasn’t had much contact with twolegs until very recently when his family moved to the city. He is not familiar with twoleg bathrooms and couldn’t use the facilities there anyway due to his body shape, at least not without some help initially. At home when nature calls, Ferdinand would just step outside and quickly run to the potty spot in the corner of the lawn.

Ferdinand at two and a half years of age:
Ferdinand is remotely aware of his potty needs. He sometimes tells when he has to go if he isn’t distracted, but there still is very little warning time and more often than not it is more a “I am pottying” than “I have to potty” with him. Even when he doesn’t realise them himself, Ferdinand has some telltale signs he is about to go potty. His parents have learned to read those signs and they usually take him outside in time. They consider putting a horse diaper on him in the city.

Ferdinand at four years of age:
Ferdinand can tell rather reliably when he has to go potty, though he still has accidents. He has trouble waiting for very long and sometimes he will get distracted and realise too late that he has to potty. Ferdinand still displays his telltale signs for anybody who knows how to read him. He will ask for help or go to the potty spot by himself if he knows where it is. He knows that it is a big no-no to go potty indoors, and he thinks that everybody has a potty spot somewhere on their lawn or garden. However, when in a pinch he believes it is ok to do his business anywhere outside.

Ferdinand at six years of age:
Ferdinand is mostly accident-free, though he still can’t wait very long when he has to go to the potty. He knows that he is to use the potty spot to do his business and to ask where it is if he doesn’t know. He has grown a bit shy to communicate his potty needs, though, and may wait too long before he asks. Ferdinand is increasingly aware of his telltale signs and can partly suppress them if he feels embarrassed about his need to potty. He is aware that it isn’t ok to just potty anywhere outside and he’ll only do it if he can’t get to a potty spot in time.

We meet Ferdinand at…

153.content:
This choice is for any character whose identity is described as outside of the binary pairing of male and female, however one wishes to describe it. It also is intended to potentially describe characters who would say they have no gender, as well as characters whose gender is unspecified, undecided, or unknown.

How would you describe your character?
153.title: Different Gender or Unspecified

1531.content: A human of a non-binary or unspecified gender situated in the world you and I live in here on Earth, living wherever you decide in whatever society you decide. We assume they live a somewhat normal life, but maybe not. Maybe it could even get a bit fantastic if you really wanted, but most like this one probably just do their business the same way as everyone else. At what point in life is this story going to take place?

1532.content:
An anthropomorphized animal--commonly referred to as a Furry as a general term, though to some it may be assumed they'd prefer their own species' name--walks and talks in a world that's a lot like our own, but probably a little different. It depends on who you ask or what you see when you look at them, regarding how these high-functioning animals look like. Anything from within the animal kingdom nearly sharing the silhouette of a human (with the likely addition of ears, snouts or beaks and a tail, or some combination of those or other features), all the way up to having distinctive animal features, every curve and angle retained from their feral counterparts retained as they manage tasks we execute, and just as easily. It could also be the case that you'd see one with large, expressive features and naturally bright colors with a nonsensical gait almost as if one walked right out of a cartoon.

This one we're talking about, what sort of time in life did they end up having to go?

1533.content:
A creature that is not (normally) found in our world on Earth, and not something that would be as simply categorized as an anthropomorphized animal, nor likely found in their world either. Creatures that could be larger or smaller, or more charming or beastly than either of the former categories. Many know these creatures as figures in myths, who can say whether this is the truth or not? Others know they have their own lands and their own devices they deal with, generally far removed from that of our world. Other times, they might be an integral part of our world without the vast majority ever knowing it, from perching on our shoulder as we make decisions, or keeping an eye on an entire city from the clouds. There's bound to be more creatures that reside in the elusive veil of myths. Or, those that haven't been recorded by history as of yet, still waiting to come out. You'll have to describe those yourself, of course.

Roughly, around what time in their life did this fantastic creature have to do their business this time? (Or, if due to immortality or inconceivably long life span this is non-applicable, was this time during their earliest, most fond period of time, toward the middle, or toward their latest most fond period of time experienced?)

info.brief_description: Stories about doing what you gotta do when nature calls.
info.description:
4-23-2019
Apologies for the brief time the interactive spent in private, but it's open again after some editing, deleting and re-organizing.

When You Gotta Go
An interactive created to write about different characters in different situations who all need to take care of their business, one way or another. Characters of all shapes, sizes, ages and genders from any time or place in their own world are welcome to have their stories about going to the bathroom (or not) written out.

Expected sub-themes include
- Needing to go to the bathroom and how the character acts in response, whether it be #1 or #2 related
- Desperation or needing to wait longer than one had expected
- Illustration of how characters act while they need to go but aren't able to yet
- Decisions that are made regarding how and when they opt to relieve themselves (However either may end up)
- Reflection on how others on society, or the lack of others, affect their decision on how to take care of their business
- Privacy/Openness of expressing their need to go to the bathroom
- How they conduct themselves when they make it to their choice of location in which to relieve themselves...
- ...Or if they even make it to that point, and whether that outcome was intentional or not.
- Any other sort of theme or angle you might want to explore. As long as it's about characters going or needing to go to the bathroom, just about anything goes.

- Write in whatever perspective you'd like. Feel free to use the text tools above the writing field to spice up the story if you'd like. Do your best to keep characters in-character.

- Detailed additions encouraged. It's totally fine if you aren't able to write several paragraphs or a short novel each entry, but do try to aim for at least one paragraph. The length of your entry isn't what's important, the content is. Try to make entries meaningful and written with content that other writers can work off of. For that matter, make sure the choices you leave are meaningful and worth working with as well.

Rules

1. Original characters only.
This interactive is designed to spur new creativity in us writers, not to take shortcuts via official or characters set within their own canon (characters from TV shows, games, etc) trudging through derivative situations in which we have little to no insight or reference related to how they would act, if at all. Characters or stories referencing anything from an already established canon that is not your own will be deleted.

2. Leaving choices: Path extension and Story progression
If the story is still being decided, leave an 'other' option as the last choice. Example:
"...How about some more choices for characters? (No story being told yet, just starting choices)"
1. Billy
2. Bob
3. Other <--- Leave a choice open for others to leave their own suggestions in the next page, so on and so forth.
If the story has been decided, leaving an 'other' choice is recommended, but not totally necessary. Still, consider other writers who may add on to it. Example:
"...So then they had to think of what to do. What happened next?(Story in progress, try to keep it moving!)"
1. They went left.
2. They went right.
3. They went down the middle.
---> Or...
3. Other/Something else happened/etc
if us writers leave a decent amount of paths open, we can feel free to end stories where we see fit and perhaps think of sequels or similar ideas later down the line.

3. Leaving choices: Versatile options for the next writer
Do not leave irrelevant or unimportant choices for the next writer. Be considerate of the readers and the next writer who'll pick up after you. Example:
Do
"And then what happened?"
1. They took an action referenced or alluded to within the body written above. (Story goes in 'direction A')
2. They acted on something else referenced or hinted at earlier on, possibly counter to the first choice given. (Story goes in 'direction B')
3. They did something completely different, a subversion that ensures the story will go in an interesting direction. (Story goes in 'direction C')
Don't
"And then what happened?"
1. They ate Cheerios for breakfast.
2. They ate Captain Crunch for breakfast.
3. They ate Apple Jacks for breakfast.
(Any of which could be described as having equally as little influence on the story as any other choice here)
Or other, similarly inconsequential choices that fail to provide an option for a decent amount of progression or change in the story.

4. Content
- Any reasonable bathroom/potty situation is fine to write about, but please don't be overly graphic or unnecessarily detailed. When in doubt, leave it to the reader's imagination.
- Other kinks are acceptable once in a while, as long as the focus remains on needing to go to the bathroom.
- Profanity is discouraged. If you must include it, keep it light. If not, just allude to cruder dialogue.
- Sexuality is acceptable to explore to a small degree. It's understandable if a story just so happens to involve it as one of several elements provided that is not detailed or made a focus of a story. General, non-sexually suggestive nudity is technically fine as long as it's relevant to the story. However, exclusively and explicitly sexual material/activity should not be detailed in stories, and especially not included in ones that are about or involve younger characters.
